description: This is a cool little destination in Londonderry.  Londonderry was once a bustling town and had the second highest production of iron in North America.   This means there are lots of remnants to explore around there.  One of the coolest one is a series of old coke ovens lined up in the forest mere feet from a well travelled road. Go to the coke ovens and then walk towards the river to see the huge slag piles that are left from that industrial area.
directions: Park at intersection of Base Line Rd and Broadway street.  On north side of Base Line rd, there is an atv path.  Take it and within a few metres go totally east.  Within a few ten of metres, the slopes goes up and the coke ovens are lined up right there around ( 45°28'37.92"N,  63°36'4.87"W).  Once you have done this part hike to  45°28'41.41"N,  63°36'28.40"W to see the slag piles
title: Londonderry Coke Ovens
